topic.title: HPE Helion Public Cloud CLI Software for Windows PowerShell Command Line Reference

body.p: Below you can find a full reference of supported HPE Helion Public Cloud CLI software for Windows PowerShell commands (sometimes called "cmdlets"). The commands are broken up into separate sections by functional area:

Note: The HPE Helion Public Cloud CLI software for Windows PowerShell cmdlets are not case specific; in other words, Get-Catalog and get-catalog function identically. When referencing an argument, like a container name, that has a space, use quotes to access that resource. For example:

codeblock.codeph: PS: HPCS:\> cd "my container:" PS: HPCS:\> new-container -name "my new container"

section.title: Non-service-specific
section.p: Following is the complete list of HPE Helion Public Cloud Windows CLI commands that are not applicable to a specific service (compute, object storage, etc.). To issue these commands, you need to navigate to a container or the HPE Helion Public Cloud Services (HPCS) provider, issuing the following command:

section.title: Get-Catalog
section.p: Displays the current user's service catalog that was retrieved at login time. This catalog stores each service the user has authorization to use.

dlentry.dd: Verbose mode; displays detailed information about each service that's available

section.title: Examples
section.p: Lists the available services with extended information about each available service.

section.title: Get-Config
section.p: Lists the config file entries for the current session.

section.title: Examples

codeblock.codeph:
PS HPCS:\> get-config
============================================================================================== Current Session Settings are as follows. ==============================================================================================
Configuration File located at C:\Users\morando\Documents\HP\CLI.config
Name Value ---- ----- LogReadAttemptsMax 20 ReleaseNotesURI https://a248.e.akamai.net/cdn.hpcloudsvc.com/hdb0a98359ca04396dd429335015a1b4b/prodaw... AccessKey *********** AuthenticationServiceURI https://region-a.geo-1.identity.hpcloudsvc.com:35357/v2.0/tokens HttpTimeoutInterval 9200000 RDPClientPath 40000 EnableCredentialTracking true LogReadAttemptIntervalInMil... 40000 delimiter / DefaultTenantId PasteGetURIResultsToClipboard true max-keys 10000 SecretKey ***********
PS HPCS:\>

section.p: Displays the settings for the session. The above example shows all currently-configurable environment variables.

section.title: Get-Metadata
section.p: Lists the Metadata entries assigned to the supplied resource.

section.title: Description
section.p: You can list metadata assigned to Servers, Storage Objects, and Containers. Many resources can have zero to many custom meta-data entries assigned to them. Get-Metadata generates a list of key value pairs attached to the resource; you may use these for whatever purpose you like. (For details on how to add meta-data elements, see the Set-Metadata cmdlet.)

dlentry.dd: Path to the remote storage object. You can express paths as fully qualified (absolute) or relative to the current location in the store.
Server ID.
Container name.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Generates a list of name value pairs assigned to the object via the copy operation's use of the -md argument.
Lists all metadata entries for the server with the ID=23465.
Lists all metadata entries for the container "Marketing".

section.title: get-notes
section.p: Displays the release notes for the current version. You can filter the release notes to a specific version or show all previous release notes.

dlentry.dd: Prints all release notes
Prints the release notes for the specific WinCLI version in the for of xx.xx.xx.xx.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Displays which availability zone is currently being used.

section.title: Examples

codeblock.codeph:
PS HPCS:\\> get-zones
Current Availability Zones include
Zone Id Name Shell Foreground Color Is Default ------- ---- ---------------------- ---------- 1 az-1.region-a.geo-1 Green True 2 az-2.region-a.geo-1 Red False 3 az-3.region-a.geo-1 Blue False 4 az-1.region-b.geo-1 Magenta False
PS HPCS:\\>

section.p: Displays all the availability zones with their color information.

section.title: Set-Config
section.p: Changes specific settings on a per session basis. All settings may be changed simultaneously by supplying the path to a different config file.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Changes the HttpTimeout setting to 100 miliseconds
Replaces all current session settings with those defined within the testconfig.config file.
Resets the current session settings to those defined within the default config file (CLI.config)

section.title: Set-Credentials
section.p: Sets the credentials (access key, secret key, and so on) for your session.

section.title: Syntax
section.p: Note: If you execute set-credentials with no arguments or options, you are prompted for the input values.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Sets the session credentials for the access key to 12345678901234:12345678901234, secret key to abcd1EFGH2ijklmnop3QRSTUV4wxyz5678, and tenant ID to 31415926535898.

section.title: Set-Metadata
section.p: Allows you to add meta-data elements to an existing resource. Storage objects can have zero to many custom meta-data entries assigned to them. This is essentially a list of key value pairs attached to the object that you may use for whatever you would like. Delimit the name value pairs (NVPs) with the pipe symbol | and enclose them in quotes. You can delimit multiple NVPs with commas.

dlentry.dd: Path to the remote storage object. You can express paths as fully qualified (absolute) or relative to the current location in the store.
Server ID.
Pipe-delimited set of key value pairs separated by commas.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Adds the KVPs "Author|Tom" and "Editor|Sam" to the file test.txt.
Applies the KVPs "Author|Tom" and "Editor|Sam" to the server with the ID=1345.

section.title: Set-Zone
section.p: Sets the availability zone; all subsequently-issued commands will apply to the assigned availability zone.

section.title: Compute CLI Commands
section.p: Following is the complete list of HPE Helion Public Cloud Windows Compute CLI commands.

section.title: Add-Rule
section.p: Creates a new security group rule and assigns it to an existing security group.

dlentry.dd: From Port: designates the low end of the port range to which this rule applies.
To Port: designates the high end of the port range to which this rule applies.
/-separated range of IP addresses to which the rule applies (highest/lowest).
The protocol affected by this rule. Valid values include tcp, udp, and icmp.
The security group ID used to apply this rule. If your current location is within one of these groups the ID is implied and therefore optional.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new security group rule affecting the TCP protocol from port 80 to 84, and assigns it to SecurityGroup 2133.

section.title: Allocate-IP
section.p: Requests a new Floating IP and adds to your IP pool.

section.title: Assign-IP
section.p: Assigns an allocated IP address to an existing server.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Assigns the IP address 192.168.45 to the server with the ID -s 4ee64397-1253-473c-a81d-bc23dceeef31.

section.title: Connect-Server
section.p: Creates quick connection to the designated server instance.
Note: Currently available for Windows instances only.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Performs a connection to the server with the ID 123456.

section.title: Get-Limits
section.p: Shows your quota amounts for Compute assets

section.title: Get-Password
section.p: Displays the password for a server instance.

section.title: Syntax
section.p: If you do not enter the keypair name, Get-Password prompts you for it. In order to invoke get-password, both of the following must be true:

ul.li: The server must appear in the server list
The listing of the EventLog for the server (PS HPCS:\Servers\server_id\EventLog), must display the encrypted key

section.p: Note: This cmdlet is currently available for Windows instances only. This password is not updated if you re-sync the administrator password with the reset-password command; it displays the original generated password as long as the eventlog is available.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Displays the password for the server instance 123456.

section.title: Ls
section.p: Lists the currently-available servers, flavors, images, networking, and security group and their associated information. The information listed is dependent on the directory in which you execute the command. For example, if you are in the directory "\Servers", the server information is listed.
Note: The HPE Helion Public Cloud environment CLI software for Windows PowerShell supports the standard Windows wildcard characters asterix (*), question mark (?), and range brackets ([]).

section.title: Examples
section.p: Lists the currently-available servers and their associated details.
Lists the currently-available flavors and their associated details.

dlentry.dd: Floating IP port identifier value.
Floating IP network identifier value.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new Floating IP address for Network 12857174-99cf-40e9-999e-fb0fa2e84898 and Port bd1c30f7-71f1-455e-b91e-8d03da7f5224

section.title: New-Image
section.p: Creates a new server image based on an existing server.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new server instance testserver based on the existing server instance testserver.

section.title: New-Keypair
section.p: Creates a new keypair. The keypair is stored by default in C:\Users\*username*\Documents\HP.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new keypair with the name "TestKey.pem".

dd.p: AdminStateUp. Determines if AdminStateUp flag is true or false.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new Network testNet1 with AdminStateUp set to "true".

section.title: Syntax
section.p: new-port -n Name - asu AdminStateUp -nid NetworkID -did PortsDeviceID

dd.p: Determines if AdminStateUp flag is true or false.

dlentry.dd: Identifies Port Device.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new Port called testNet1 on Network bd1c30f7-71f1-455e-b91e-8d03da7f5224 with its AdminStateUp set to true and a Device = sdf\etc.

dd.p: Determines if AdminStateUp flag is true or false.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new Router called testRouter1 on External Network bd1c30f7-71f1-455e-b91e-8d03da7f5224 with its AdminStateUp set to true.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new relationship between Router (bd1c30f7-71f1-455e-b91e-8d03da7f5224), Port (c9e32588-5b69-4100-a1a6-fa49094ec0a8) and Subnet (7yuu9886-5b69-4100-a1a6-fa49094ec0a8)

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new security group with the name "TestGroup" and the description "SomeDescription".

dlentry.dd: Server name.
The image identifier (ImageRefId) used to define this server.
The flavor identifier (FlavorRefId) used to define the server.
Pipe-delimited set of metadata name value pairs separated by commas.
The identifier (ServerId) used to associate the metadata for the server. If your currently viewing a servers details, this parameter may be omitted as it's supplied for you.
Set of SecurityGroup names that are to be applied to the newly created server separated by commas.
Keypair for this server.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new server with the name TestServer, along with some metadata.

codeblock.codeph: PS HPCS:\Flavors> New-Server -n TestServer -s "default" cmdlet New-Server at command pipeline position 1 Supply values for the following parameters: (Type !? for Help.) ImageRef: 102 FlavorRef: 100 KeyName: mySecurityGroup

section.p: Creates a new server with the name 'TestServer'. In this example, the user is prompted for the Image, Flavor, and KeyName values rather than entering them on the command line directly.

dd.p: Lists Allocation Pools, separating them by commas.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new Subnet called testSubnet.

section.title: Ping-Server
section.p: Sends echo request packets to the named server.

section.title: Examples

codeblock.codeph:
PS HPCS:\Servers> ping-server 123456
2 assigned IP addresses found. Ping results are as follows.
Pinging Server : 10.5.180.96 Time to live : 64 Don't fragment : True ping status : TimedOut
Pinging Server : 15.185.107.139 Time to live : 64 Don't fragment : True ping status : Success Address : 15.185.107.139 RoundTrip time : 62 Time to live : 59 Don't fragment : False Buffer size : 32

section.p: Sends echo request packets to the server with the ID 123456 and returns the results.

section.title: Reboot-Server
section.p: Allows you to perform either a soft or hard reboot of a server. With a soft reboot, the operating system is signaled to restart, which allows for a graceful shutdown of all processes. A hard reboot is the equivalent of cycling power on the server.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Performs a soft reboot of server 4516.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Refreshes the cache for your current shell.

section.title: Remove-FloatingIP
section.p: Removes an existing Floating IP address.

dd.p: Identifies the Floating IP address to remove.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Deletes the Floating IP with id of 4ee64397-1253-473c-a81d-bc23dceeef31.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Removes the keypair with the name TestKey.

dd.p: Identifies Floating IP address to remove.

dlentry.dd: Removes all Floating IP addresses.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Deletes the Network with the id of 12857174-99cf-40e9-999e-fb0fa2e84898

section.title: Examples
section.p: Deletes the Port with the id of 12857174-99cf-40e9-999e-fb0fa2e84898

section.title: Examples
section.p: Removes the Router with the id of 12857174-99cf-40e9-999e-fb0fa2e84898

section.title: Remove-RouterInterface
section.p: Removes an existing relationship between a Router and a Subnet.

codeblock.codeph: # remove-routerinterface -id 12857174-99cf-40e9-999e-fb0fa2e84898 -sid Removes the association between Router 12857174-99cf-40e9-999e-fb0fa2e84898 and Subnet bd1c30f7-71f1-455e-b91e-8d03da7f5224

section.title: Remove-Rule
section.p: Removes an existing security group rule.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Removes the rule with the ID of 3244.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Removes the security group with the ID of 3244.

dlentry.dd: Deletes all servers

section.title: Examples
section.p: Removes the Subnet with the id of 12857174-99cf-40e9-999e-fb0fa2e84898

section.title: Reset-Password
section.p: Re-syncs your Windows administrator password for the given server, after manual modification, in order to use the connect-server cmdlet.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Re-syncs the Windows session administrator password with that of the server with the ID of "3245" to "testpassword08".

section.title: Set-ZoneColor
section.p: Sets the availability zone; all subsequently-issued commands are applied to the assigned availability zone.

section.title: Examples

codeblock.codeph:
PS HPCS:\\> set-zonecolor 1 Cyan
az-1.region-a.geo-1 now assigned to Cyan.
PS HPCS:\\>

section.p: Sets the color identifier for zone 1 to cyan. The color names must be capitalized (as in the example).

section.title: Unassign-IP
section.p: Unassigns an IP address for an existing Server.

dd.p: The Server ID that is disassociated from the IP address.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Removes the supplied IP address from server 4ee64397-1253-473c-a81d-bc23dceeef31

section.title: Examples
section.p: Updates the Floating IP (12857174-99cf-40e9-999e-fb0fa2e84898) to the new Port (c9e32588-5b69-4100-a1a6-fa49094ec0a8)

section.title: Update-Server
section.p: Allows you to change the server name property.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Changes the name of server 2133 to "NewName".

section.title: Examples
section.p: # update-Subnet -id 12857174-99cf-40e9-999e-fb0fa2e84898 -egw 129.15.124.12 -n "NewSubnetName" Reassigns the Subnet(12857174-99cf-40e9-999e-fb0fa2e84898) to the designated External Network with the new name of "NewSubnetName".

section.title: Object Storage CLI Commands
section.p: Following is the complete list of HPE Helion Public Cloud Windows Object Storage CLI commands.

section.title: Cd
section.p: Allows you to traverse through a directory structure (along both ascendant and descendant axis).

section.title: Examples
section.p: Sets the current folder to "bar" location 2 levels deep.
Moves the current folder to "foo" from its current position (bar)

section.title: Copy
section.p: Allows you to move files in the following ways:

ul.li: From Object Storage to the Local Client

section.p: Note: copy supports the standard Windows wildcard characters asterix (*), question mark (?), and range brackets ([]).

section.title: Examples
section.p: Copies the entire folder named "test" to the current location within Object Storage. This is a non-recursive operation.
Copies the entire folder named "test" (along with all descendant folders) to the current location within Object Storage. This is a recursive operation.
This copies the folder within Object Storage called "test" to the folder named "incoming". Both folders are adjacent to the current directory.
This example copies the file "anothertest.txt" location two levels deep from the current location within Object Storage, to the local Incoming folder.
This examples copies the folder folder1 from container sourceContainerName to container targerContainerName.

section.title: Copy-Item
section.p: Copies an item from one location to another.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Copy's the object my-file to the object backup-file.

section.title: Del
section.p: Note: del supports the standard Windows wildcard characters asterix (*), question mark (?), and range brackets ([]).

dlentry.dd: Path to the storage object to be removed

section.title: Examples
section.p: Removes the storage object test.xml from the current directory.

section.title: Get-Uri
section.p: Lists the fully qualified URI of the resource that you supply. The optional parameters allow you to define a timespan for the URI. When you issue this command, the URI is also pasted to the Windows clipboard for your convenience. If you want to disable this behavior, set the CLI.config option PasteGetURIResultsToClipboard to false.

dlentry.dd: Source path to the storage object
Number of days the URI is valid
Number of seconds the URI is valid

section.title: Examples

codeblock.codeph:
PS yourContainer:\> get-uri anothertest.txt.
Object located at : https://region-a.geo-1.objects.hpcloudsvc.com/v1/AUTH_e9e11fd3-ec18-4415-8b4f-e7b7ec9eed8e/Kaushik/test11.html

section.p: Displays the fully qualified URI for the file anothertest.txt.

codeblock.codeph:
PS yourContainer:\> get-uri anothertest.txt -dv 27
Object located at : https://region-a.geo-1.objects.hpcloudsvc.com/v1/AUTH_e9e11fd3-ec18-4415-8b4f-e7b7ec9eed8e/Kaushik/test11.html?temp_url_sig=95110298407447%3a95110298407447%3a75713970004400%3a84d2be6d472d06b7e83ca4af42b5ea14cc01596c &temp_url_expires=1361904513 Url Expiration Date : 2/26/2013. [120 day(s) \ 1361904513 seconds.]

section.p: Displays the URI for the file anothertest.txt, where the URI is valid for 27 days.

section.title: Ls
section.p: Allows you to list available resources within the current Container.
Note: ls supports the standard Windows wildcard characters asterix (*), question mark (?), and range brackets ([]).

section.title: Examples
section.p: Lists the contents of the current folder (in this case root)
Lists the contents of the "bar" folder located two levels from the current directory (root).

section.title: Md
section.p: Allows you organize your resources within Object Storage in a hierarchical fashion through the use of folders.

section.title: Examples
section.p: This creates a sub-folder under the current folder (in this example root).
This examples creates another sub-folder but this time the target location is two levels deep from the current location (root).

section.title: Migrate-Drive
section.p: Migrates existing stores of data from external sources like S3, Dropbox and Skydrive to a target Container within HPE Object Storage.

dlentry.dd: Bucket type, e.g. S3
Secret key ID.
Access key ID.
Comma-deliniated bucket names to be copied to the HPE Helion Public Cloud system.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Copies the testb1 and testb2 S3 buckets to the HPE object storage containers of the same name, using a secret-key value of "aa78676dhhh100" and an access-key value of "jhjhgu64332".

section.title: Examples
section.p: Creates a new container named marketing.

section.title: Remove-Container
section.p: After confirmation, deletes a container entirely. If any files exist within the container, they are deleted as well.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Deletes the container named marketing and all of its contents.

section.title: Remove-Item
section.p: Removes an object from your object storage container.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Removes the object 'my-object from the container.

section.title: Remove-Metadata
section.p: Removes the metadata from an object in storage.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Removes the metadata from the object my-object.

section.title: Set-Scope
section.p: Sets the scope of a Private Container to Public.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Allows you to access resources hosted within the Marketing Container over the public Internet.

section.title: Attach-Volume
section.p: Associates a volume with an existing server.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Associates the volume with the volume ID 2345 to the server with the ID of 21, with the assigned device name of /dev/vdX.

section.title: Detach-Volume
section.p: Disassociates a volume from an existing server.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Disassociates the volume with the ID of 2345 from the server with the ID of 21.

section.title: New-Snapshot
section.p: Creates a new snapshot of your block storage volumes.

section.title: Examples

codeblock.codeph: # new-snapshot "TestSnapshot" "This is a simple Snapshot test" 2344

section.p: Creates a snapshot with the name TestSnapshot and the description This is a simple Snapshot test of the block storage volume with the ID of 2344.

section.title: New-Volume
section.p: Creates a new block storage volume.

section.title: Examples

codeblock.codeph: # new-volume "TestVolume" "This is a simple Volume test" 20

section.p: Creates the new volume TestVolume with a size of 20 gigabytes and the description "This is a simple Volume test".

codeblock.codeph: # new-volume "TestVolume" "This is a simple Volume test" 20 "test|data", "another|test"

section.p: Creates the new volume TestVolume with a size of 20 gigabytes, the metadata test|data and another|test, and the description "This is a simple Volume test".

section.title: Remove-Snapshot
section.p: Deletes an existing block storage snapshot.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Deletes the snapshot with the snapshot ID of 2457.

section.title: Remove-Volume
section.p: Deletes an existing block storage volume.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Removes the block storage volume with the ID of 2457.
